column2: Test Case 1:Trade price worse than the same side CBOE Market- Firm Quote
Test Scenario B:Sell side- Origin C
Test Scenario C:BUY SIDE-Origin X (Par price is worse than CBOE and Away Market)
Test Case 2:Partial trade will be consider trade through since trade price is worse than the same side cboe market
Test Scenario B:Sell side- Origin N
Test Case 3:Trade price better than the same side of CBOE market- NEGATIVE CASE
Test Scenario A:Trading price better than cboe quote
Test Case 4:Trade price equals the same side of CBOE market- NEGATIVE CASE
Test Scenario A:Trading price equals CBOE best maket. Quote
Test Case 5:Partial trades with worst price better price and equal price (Positve and negative case)
Test Scenario A:1st trade worst price second better price third equal price
Test Scenario B:1st trade equal second better price third worse price
Test Scenario C:3 partial trades all at worst price all should have a trade through alert
Test Case 6:Trade price worse than the same side CBOE Market- Fast State (Negative case)
Test Case 7:Firm Quote trade through- only for origins B C F N X and Y are Checked for trade through Alert- Negative case
Test Case 8:quote changes so trade price is better- No trade through alert
Test Scenario A:quote changed so par trade price is better no trade though alert
Test Case 9:Quote- Quote is wider than EPW
Test Scenario A:even when Market is too wide TT alert will still be reproduced
Test Case 10:One sided Quote at the top of the book(buy and sell) no quote at the TOB
Test Scenario A:one side quote on the buy side
Test Scenario B:one side quote on theSell side
Test Scenario C:no Market. no TT alert should be produced
Test Case 11:On-going Auction should t affect Trade through
Test Scenario A:Hal auction begins then incoming par order that trade through alert
Test Scenario B:Hal auction begins then incoming par order that won t trade through alert
